line_1: Glides unobserv'd, nor tainted by Extremes,
line_2: If my still Life, like subterraneous Streams,

line_1: (Happy defect that keeps from such extreams,)
line_2: But as a Pleasure-Boat in thy smooth Streams,

line_1: But middle Natures joyn the vast Extreams.
line_2: Light Æther well may scorn the creeping Streams,

line_1: But middle Natures joyn the vast Extreams.
line_2: And subtil Fire with Earth ill-mated seems;

line_1: Nor could it fear the hard extremes,
line_2: It was not fed by airy dreams,

line_1: And for no other Reason but her loath'd Extremes.
line_2: All shun her like the Cocatrice's Beams,

line_1: Whilst Man too feeble for their bright extreams,
line_2: With such soft Smiles as yours they'r forc't to allay their Beams.

line_1: Your busy, or your vain Extreams;
line_2: Go search among your idle Dreams,

line_1: And Plague the howling Ghosts with worse extreams:
line_2: Earth cracks, to Hell descend the hated beams,

line_1: Rack'd with new Forms, and tortur'd with Extremes;
line_2: Here at a stand our weary'd Sorrow seems

line_1: " Why will ye joyn such wide Extreams?
line_2: " At desperate Chance and Bloody Games?

line_1: Prompt his young Thoughts to run on new Extreams,
line_2: And Sycophantick Pride his Heart Enflames;

line_1: But, if revolv'd to opposite Extreams,
line_2: When Prosp'rous Days around him spread their Beams:

line_1: And thirst and hunger mix their wild extremes;
line_2: When the fierce Sun darts vertical his beams,
